docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 2:21 p.m. Amid public outrage over employee bonuses at troubled firms like Merrill Lynch and the American International Group, the Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, called on Friday for executive pay policies that are created with a company's long-term health in mind, The New York Times's Jack Healy reports.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two top advisers to Alan G. Hevesi, the former state comptroller, were charged in a 123-count grand jury indictment that said they had turned New York's $122 billion pension fund into a criminal enterprise by taking tens of millions of dollars in kickbacks for themselves.

headline.main: Two Ex-Hevesi Aides Charged in Fraud Scheme

docs.lead_paragraph: The A.I.G. executive who was nicknamed "Jackpot Jimmy" by a New York tabloid walked up the driveway toward his bay-windowed house in Fairfield, Conn., on Thursday afternoon. "How do I feel?" said the executive, James Haas, repeating the question he had just been asked. "I feel horrible. This has been a complete invasion of privacy."
